voice: I remember and I will share.
display_name: Channel of the Prodigal (13–33) — Design of a Witness
keynotes: stories of the past shared for meaning, not proof
confidant energy: people tell you their stories
themes of secrets, testimony, and discretion
melancholy between cycles of retreat and sharing
informs the collective with lessons from the past
notes:
Overview: Channel 13–33 links Gate 13 (The Listener) in the G Center with Gate 33 (Privacy/Retreat/Remembering) in the Throat. In the Collective Abstract/Sensing stream, its role is to **witness life, remember it, and share when asked** so the collective can draw meaning from the past. Classic name: **The Prodigal — a design of a witness.**

Line Companion / Jovian-style pulls (≤25 words):
1) "Gate 13 is the listener; it holds the stories." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 13)
2) "Secrets are safe here when correct." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 13)
3) "Gate 33 is privacy and retreat." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 33)
4) "Remembering the past to share later." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 33)
5) "The Prodigal — a design of a witness." — Ra Uru Hu, 13–33

Mechanics:
- **G (13)** attracts and archives people’s stories; it is the auric confession booth.
- **Throat (33)** requires withdrawal/retreat to distill experience into a shareable narrative.
- As Collective Abstract, it offers **meaning from memory**, not logical proof or immediate solutions.

High expression:
- Trusted keeper of stories; shares with grace and discretion when invited.
- Uses personal and collective history to guide culture.
- Understands timing: first **retreat/remember**, then **speak**.

Low expression / distortion:
- Oversharing private material; breaking confidences.
- Speaking before the story has been digested.
- Holding on to the past as identity rather than as teaching.

Strategy & timing:
- This is **projected** — best received when **asked** to tell the story.
- Honor the need for **privacy**; retreat restores memory clarity.

Tags for your HD JSON corpus:
- witness, memory-keeper, retreat-then-share, confidant, past-to-meaning, projected voice, collective storytelling.
